boardgame.name: Paris Connection
SNCF
boardgame.description: A re-issue of David V. H. Peters' SNCF (Soci_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;t_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute; Nationale des Chemins de fer Fran_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ccedil;ais). Originally released by Winsome Games as part of its 2010 Essen Set, SNCF was subsequently licensed by Queen Games and rereleased as Paris Connection in 2011. This is a fast network-/portfolio-building game with a train theme, with the objective of having the most valuable stock portfolio at the end of the game. Players can own and trade stocks as well as influence the value of each company._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;There are 6 colors of wooden locomotives, each color representing a company. Players are dealt random hands of 5-10 (depending on number of players) locomotives, which are essentially a stock portfolio; the rest of each color are placed in a pool. On your turn, you can either increase the value of a single company by placing 1-5 locomotives from the remaining pool of that company, or you can trade one locomotive in your portfolio for one or two locomotives from the remaining pool in a company._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game board is a map of France, with cities worth anywhere from 1-4 points, and rural hexes worth 0. Connecting to a city adds to a company's value._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game ends when Marseille is reached by a company, or when there is only one company with locomotives remaining in the pool. Players' scores are determined by the value of each company at the end multiplied by the number of locomotives the player has for each color._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;SNCF expansions may be used with this game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Queen Games (QNG60711) The players are planning a French railway engineers to connect as many cities in the country to the rail network. Of course they try it, represented mainly by the railway companies to be profitable. Flexible and skillful bluffing tactics make the outcome of the game unpredictable. Paris Connection is a fast and easy-to-learn family game!

Game is complete and in excellent condition. Take advantage of my shelf-space woes! When you buy more than one game, pay full price for your highest priced item, but get 20% off of each additional item. US buyers - please note: shipping to the US is very expensive. To ship a Days of Wonder shaped box runs approximately $25, if not more.

This listing is for a lightly played copy of SNCF, first edition by Winsome Games (2010). Also included are the Germany, Netherlands, and Iberia expansions, also by Winsome Games. Game is in great shape and comes in original clamshell packaging. Expansions are unplayed and are included in the base game clamshell. Buyer pays $13.60 for USPS Priority Mail Flat Rate shipping. I only accept PayPal. I am selling several other Winsome games and can combine shipping, up to 3 games will fit in 1 flat rate box for the same shipping cost. Please contact me with any questions.

** INCLUDES: Base game, Germany/Iberia expansion (2011), Netherlands expansion (2012) ** Excellent condition, complete, base game and expansions never played Box: Plastic clamshell shows no issues Maps: Excellent with no noted issues Rules: Excellent, with no thumbing or dog ears Issue: Player hides were laminated and cut along dotted lines before reading that they weren_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t cards (Oops!) Weight: 0lb 14oz I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m prepared to listen to an offer, and would be more likely to consider if you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re buying several games. Low-ball offers are likely to be ignored. *** All games on my _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;For Trade_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; list will be listed eventually - feel free to look through them and make offers *** Shipping is done from 33947 via USPS Priority or Ground service, and I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll do my best to keep your costs down using Flat-rate and Regional-rate boxes if that works out cheapest. I ship to mainland US addresses only. (A couple of bad experiences.) Payments via PayPal are preferred (extra charged to cover any fees), but checks, money orders, cash, and other options considered. Any excess paid is always refunded. Not looking for any trades at this point. You can always try, but it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s likely I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll say no.
